attributes.action: Restore The 10 Percent Income Tax Band
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The abolition of the 10 percent tax band will hit people on low incomes the most. This is especially so, when these tax increase come on top of above inflation increases in Council Tax, Water Rates, fuel bills etc.

Gordon Brown has claimed that the decrease in income will be offset by increases in Tax Credits. However, not everyone is eligible for Tax Credits. For example, people who work part time, and those who don’t have dependent children, are excluded. 

In my own case, I can only work part time because I need to care for my disabled wife, who is also in a very poor state of health. Consequently I cannot claim Tax Credits.

In addition, many people who are eligible for Tax Credits do not claim because they simply don’t know how to go about claiming them.

The obvious solution to this would be to restore the 10 percent Income Tax band.
